page.title: 11FAIRACRE
page.content: The house called Fairacre stands on the site of an ancient house called Sigers which was owned by John Ferne of Wylchers in the year 1565.The house Fairacre extended from Wiltshire Lane to Fore Street,which was called Frog Lane.In 1853 the house and land were leased to George Baylis,with authority for him to have a brickfield in the area now covered by Salisbury Road.The present house dates back in time from around 1916 and was probably built by a Captain Bennett Edwards of Haydon Hall.A Mr Collins lived in Fairacre and his initials can be seen on a nearby boundary post.Fairacre was restored by Hillingdon Borough Council in 1978 and the house now forms part of a Borough housing scheme for the elderly people in the nearby area.
